6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:25): reviewing needed :)
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:25): callback is wrong...
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:26): should file bugs
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:26): callback is right
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:26): it is wrong :)
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:26): it has never been right in the D4 draft

6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:28): let me find the right syntax...
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:28): it should allow { handleMutation: function() {} }
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:28): no it shouldn't
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:28): we had a long discussion on that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:28): so yeah, not a bug
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:29): I haven't seen such discussion about mutationcallback
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:29): anyway, I'll implement { handleMutations: function() {} } :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:29): It would be awesome if you didn't make unilateral changes in your impl that no one else wants.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:31): it would be awesome if specs wouldn't make the web APIs more inconsistent
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:31): pretty sure c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 won't allow it
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:31): { handleMutations: ... } isn't consistent anyway.  If you're making that argument, implement as { handleEvent: ... }
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (23:32): handleEvent doesn't make any sense
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (23:32): agrees with smaug
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (23:32): i think it should be onmutation
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:34): oh, please not this again
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (23:53): i do however think it's more important to make an API good, than to make it consistent with existing stuff
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (23:53): especially since we hear nothing but complaints about how much the DOM sucks
